content: sugarloaf mountain dog snood amethyst mermaidesigns the sugarloaf mountain dog snood is a nod to one of my favorite hiking places in arkansas the ridges and valleys made by the addictive front post/ back post double crochets reminds me of this beautiful mountain as the mama of a floppy eared boy you know it s only natural that i made him his own hat so he can match the family while aerating his ears tada behold the sugarloaf mountain dog snood the snood is constructed in one big circular tube to accommodate your pet s head size you ll want it to fit pretty snug to keep it from slipping off but loose enough to be comfortable for your fuzzy friend you ll find two sizing charts to help you pick the best size for the fit that you desire in this pattern you ll find a written pattern featuring five different sizes tips and up-close picture tutorials of certain techniques materials yarn worsted weight cotton yarn approximate yardage by size xsmall--- 40 yards small--- 50 yards medium--- 70 yards large--- 90 yards xlarge---110 yards hook s g 4 00mm notions scissors stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in ends measuring tape gauge 14 stitches x 10 row front post double_crochet back post double_crochet - 1 measuring your pet the circumference is the measurement that would create a circle by going across the top of the dog s head over the ears and under the chin as shown in the pictures below your dog s weight is a good indicator of which size to choose if you prefer a more snug fit for dogs that need a feeling of security or need to reduce ear flapping if you d like a snug fit choose size based on the chart below if you want a more relaxed fit choose size based on the finished dimensions on the next page finished dimensions for snug fitting snood xs s m l xl head circumference 7-9 9-13 13-18 18-23 23+ inches weight 5-10 10-20 20-50 55-95 95+ lbs -
